text: Normal weight subjects showed significant blood oxygen-dependent reactions in the ventromedial prefrontal cortex (vmPFC) to food flavors compared to reactions caused by the odor of an inedible object.

PrEP is effective in preventing HIV-1 in women who use DMPA and men whose partners use DMPA, suggesting that PrEP could reduce the potential increased HIV-1 contagion and transmission risks associated with the use of DMPA.
The SSM 30 g can be an effective, non-invasive alternative to intravenous, intramuscular or oral opioids administered by a physician to treat moderate to severe acute pain.
